columns.columnDescription: Unique identifier for each requirement, enabling precise tracking and management of requirement records. This ensures each entry can be distinctly referenced for efficient data retrieval and integrity across related tables.
Name of the requirement for a person, providing a clear and descriptive label that identifies the specific training, certification, or task that must be completed.
Current status of the requirement, indicating whether it is COMPLETE, INCOMPLETE, or in another relevant state. This helps track the progress of compliance.
Indicates whether the requirement is booked, represented as a boolean value (true/false) to indicate if the requirement has been scheduled or reserved.

Foreign key reference to Appointment Type, linking to the appointmenttype_id field in the Appointmenttype table. This establishes a relationship that identifies the specific type of appointment associated with the requirement. (ref: Appointmenttype.appointmenttype_id)

Foreign key reference to Members, linking to the members_id field in the Members table. This establishes a relationship that associates each requirement with the corresponding member responsible for fulfilling it. (ref: Members.members_id)
Index for tracking updates, allowing for the systematic recording and monitoring of any changes or revisions made to the requirement entries, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information.
